intro: Cardiagyris scabra, commonly known as the rough-stemmed morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its twining stems and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has rough, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which give it its scientific name. It produces showy, often purple or blue flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Cardiagyris scabra is typically grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
